messages.title: The Green Vision for West Berkshire

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Patients before profits with an end to creeping privatisation of the NHS. Free health care including dentistry and eye care. Mental health the same priority as physical health. Free care for over-65s who need it and disabled people.

Build sustainable homes for sale and rent. Priority for brownfield over greenfield development. Proportion to their surroundings with good transport links. Local services - surgeries, schools, and open spaces to match new housing.
Equal access to high-speed broadband in rural areas. Effective flood management. Genuine commitment to limiting climate change. Support sustainable agriculture and protect the countryside.
Free early education and fully funded children's centres. Quality, locally accountable schools. End the misguided test-driven culture of SATs, league tables, and Ofsted. Scrap tuition fees.
Return our railways to public ownership. Expand the electrification of the rail network. Build a comprehensive public transport system. Promote safe cycling and walking.

Genuine accountability and open government. A fair voting system where your vote really counts. Properly funded local councils free to manage local services. Politics driven by values, not party squabbles.

issues.education: End the misguided test-driven culture of SATs, league tables, and Ofsted. Scrap tuition fees.
issues.environment: Genuine commitment to limiting climate change. Support sustainable agriculture and protect the countryside.
issues.health: Patients before profits with an end to creeping privatisation of the NHS. Free health care including dentistry and eye care. Mental health the same priority as physical health. Free care for over-65s who need it and disabled people.

housing.content: Build sustainable homes for sale and rent. Priority for brownfield over greenfield development. Proportion to their surroundings with good transport links. Local services to match new housing.
